meanings.definition: Kotowed (verb): to bow or act in a subservient manner.
meanings.sent1: He kotowed before the king, showing respect.
meanings.sent2: She kotowed gracefully to thank the audience.
meanings.sent3: The dog kotowed playfully when asked to sit.
meanings.sent4: The trees kotowed in the wind's powerful gusts.
meanings.sent5: The robot kotowed as a sign of obedience to its master.

meanings.definition: Kotowed (adjective): showing excessive humility or deference.
meanings.sent1: Her kotowed behavior made her seem timid.
meanings.sent2: The kotowed student always followed instructions without question.
meanings.sent3: The kotowed kitten purred softly as it approached.
meanings.sent4: The kotowed clouds seemed to beg for rain.
meanings.sent5: The kotowed servant never dared to speak out of turn.

meanings.definition: Kotowed (noun): a gesture of respect or submission.
meanings.sent1: His kotowed was a sign of loyalty to his master.
meanings.sent2: The kotowed of the samurai was a tradition of honor.
meanings.sent3: The kotowed of the child made the elder smile.
meanings.sent4: The kotowed of the waves to the shore was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The kotowed of the branches in the breeze was a peaceful sight.
